alert.note: Alert for Lowndes (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 5:48PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Lowndes County through 630 PM CDT... At 547 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gordonville, or near Mosses. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mosses, Gordonville, Beechwood, Mount Willing, Clover Hill, Farmersville and Fostoria. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
